car_1.question: Which model of the car has the minimum horsepower?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id ORDER BY T2.horsepower ASC LIMIT 1;

car_1.question: What is the model of the car with the smallest amount of horsepower?

car_1.question: Find the model of the car whose weight is below the average weight.
car_1.query: SELECT T1.model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.Weight  <  (SELECT avg(Weight) FROM CARS_DATA)
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: What is the model for the car with a weight smaller than the average?

car_1.question: Find the name of the makers that produced some cars in the year of 1970?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T3 ON T2.model  =  T3.model JOIN CARS_DATA AS T4 ON T3.MakeId  =  T4.id WHERE T4.year  =  '1970';

car_1.question: Find the make and production time of the cars that were produced in the earliest year?

car_1.query: SELECT T1.CountryName FROM COUNTRIES AS T1 JOIN CONTINENTS AS T2 ON T1.Continent  =  T2.ContId JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T3 ON T1.CountryId  =  T3.Country WHERE T2.Continent  =  'europe' GROUP BY T1.CountryName HAVING count(*)  >=  3;

car_1.question: What are the names of all European countries with at least 3 manufacturers?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.CountryName FROM COUNTRIES AS T1 JOIN CONTINENTS AS T2 ON T1.Continent  =  T2.ContId JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T3 ON T1.CountryId  =  T3.Country WHERE T2.Continent  =  'europe' GROUP BY T1.CountryName HAVING count(*)  >=  3;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Country TEXT);

car_1.question: What is the maximum horsepower and the make of the car models with 3 cylinders?
car_1.query: SELECT T2.horsepower ,  T1.Make FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.cylinders  =  3 ORDER BY T2.horsepower DESC LIMIT 1;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: What is the largest amount of horsepower for the models with 3 cylinders and what make is it?
car_1.query: SELECT T2.horsepower ,  T1.Make FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.cylinders  =  3 ORDER BY T2.horsepower DESC LIMIT 1;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: Which model saves the most gasoline? That is to say, have the maximum miles per gallon.
car_1.query: SELECT T1.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id ORDER BY T2.mpg DESC LIMIT 1;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: What is the car model with the highest mpg?
car_1.query: select t1.model from car_names as t1 join cars_data as t2 on t1.makeid  =  t2.id order by t2.mpg desc limit 1;

car_1.question: What is the average horsepower of the cars before 1980?

car_1.question: What is the average horsepower for all cars produced before 1980?

car_1.question: What is the average edispl of the cars of model volvo?

car_1.question: How many car models were produced by the maker with full name American Motor Company?

car_1.question: Which makers designed more than 3 car models? List full name and the id.
car_1.query: SELECT T1.FullName ,  T1.Id FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*)  >  3;

car_1.question: What are the names and ids of all makers with more than 3 models?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.FullName ,  T1.Id FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*)  >  3;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: Which distinctive models are produced by maker with the full name General Motors or weighing more than 3500?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Model  =  T2.Model JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T3 ON T2.Maker  =  T3.Id JOIN CARS_DATA AS T4 ON T1.MakeId  =  T4.Id WHERE T3.FullName  =  'General Motors' OR T4.weight  >  3500;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: What are the different models created by either the car maker General Motors or weighed more than 3500?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Model  =  T2.Model JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T3 ON T2.Maker  =  T3.Id JOIN CARS_DATA AS T4 ON T1.MakeId  =  T4.Id WHERE T3.FullName  =  'General Motors' OR T4.weight  >  3500;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: For model volvo, how many cylinders does the car with the least accelerate have?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.cylinders FROM CARS_DATA AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.MakeId WHERE T2.Model  =  'volvo' ORDER BY T1.accelerate ASC LIMIT 1;

car_1.question: For a volvo model, how many cylinders does the version with least accelerate have?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.cylinders FROM CARS_DATA AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.MakeId WHERE T2.Model  =  'volvo' ORDER BY T1.accelerate ASC LIMIT 1;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Cylinders NUMBER, Accelerate NUMBER);

car_1.question: How many cars have a larger accelerate than the car with the largest horsepower?
car_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM CARS_DATA WHERE Accelerate  >  ( SELECT Accelerate FROM CARS_DATA ORDER BY Horsepower DESC LIMIT 1 );
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE cars_data (Horsepower TEXT, Accelerate NUMBER);

car_1.question: What is the number of cars with a greater accelerate than the one with the most horsepower?
car_1.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM CARS_DATA WHERE Accelerate  >  ( SELECT Accelerate FROM CARS_DATA ORDER BY Horsepower DESC LIMIT 1 );
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE cars_data (Horsepower TEXT, Accelerate NUMBER);

car_1.question: How many countries has more than 2 car makers?

car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, Country TEXT);

car_1.question: What is the number of countries with more than 2 car makers?
car_1.query: select count(*) from countries as t1 join car_makers as t2 on t1.countryid  =  t2.country group by t1.countryid having count(*)  >  2

car_1.question: For the cars with 4 cylinders, which model has the largest horsepower?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.Cylinders  =  4 ORDER BY T2.horsepower DESC LIMIT 1;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.query: SELECT T1.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.Cylinders  =  4 ORDER BY T2.horsepower DESC LIMIT 1;

car_1.question: Among the cars with more than lowest horsepower, which ones do not have more than 3 cylinders? List the car makeid and make name.
car_1.query: SELECT T2.MakeId ,  T2.Make FROM CARS_DATA AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.MakeId WHERE T1.Horsepower  >  (SELECT min(Horsepower) FROM CARS_DATA) AND T1.Cylinders  <=  3;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: Among the cars that do not have the minimum horsepower , what are the make ids and names of all those with less than 4 cylinders?
car_1.query: select t2.makeid ,  t2.make from cars_data as t1 join car_names as t2 on t1.id  =  t2.makeid where t1.horsepower  >  (select min(horsepower) from cars_data) and t1.cylinders  <  4;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT, Year NUMBER);

car_1.question: What is the maximum mpg of the cars that had 8 cylinders or that were produced before 1980?

car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (MPG TEXT, Cylinders NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT, Year NUMBER);

car_1.question: Which models are lighter than 3500 but not built by the 'Ford Motor Company'?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.model FROM MODEL_LIST AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Model  =  T2.Model JOIN CARS_DATA AS T3 ON T2.MakeId  =  T3.Id JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T4 ON T1.Maker  =  T4.Id WHERE T3.weight  <  3500 AND T4.FullName != 'Ford Motor Company';
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: What are the different models wthat are lighter than 3500 but were not built by the Ford Motor Company?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.model FROM MODEL_LIST AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Model  =  T2.Model JOIN CARS_DATA AS T3 ON T2.MakeId  =  T3.Id JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T4 ON T1.Maker  =  T4.Id WHERE T3.weight  <  3500 AND T4.FullName != 'Ford Motor Company';
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the name of the countries where there is not a single car maker?
car_1.query: SELECT CountryName FROM countries EXCEPT SELECT T1.CountryName FROM countries AS T1 JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T2 ON T1.countryId  =  T2.Country;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the names of the countries with no car makers?

car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: Which are the car makers which produce at least 2 models and more than 3 car makers ? List the id and the maker.
car_1.query: select t1.id ,  t1.maker from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id  =  t2.maker group by t1.id having count(*)  >=  2 intersect select t1.id ,  t1.maker from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id  =  t2.maker join car_names as t3 on t2.model  =  t3.model group by t1.id having count(*)  >  3;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the ids and makers of all car makers that produce at least 2 models and make more than 3 cars?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.Id ,  T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*)  >=  2 INTERSECT SELECT T1.Id ,  T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T3 ON T2.model  =  T3.model GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*)  >  3;
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the id and names of the countries which have more than 3 car makers or produce the 'fiat' model?
car_1.query: SELECT T1.countryId ,  T1.CountryName FROM Countries AS T1 JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T2 ON T1.CountryId  =  T2.Country GROUP BY T1.countryId HAVING count(*)  >  3 UNION SELECT T1.countryId ,  T1.CountryName FROM Countries AS T1 JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T2 ON T1.CountryId  =  T2.Country JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T3 ON T2.Id  =  T3.Maker WHERE T3.Model  =  'fiat';
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the ids and names of all countries that either have more than 3 car makers or produce fiat model?
car_1.query: select t1.countryid ,  t1.countryname from countries as t1 join car_makers as t2 on t1.countryid  =  t2.country group by t1.countryid having count(*)  >  3 union select t1.countryid ,  t1.countryname from countries as t1 join car_makers as t2 on t1.countryid  =  t2.country join model_list as t3 on t2.id  =  t3.maker where t3.model  =  'fiat';
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

flight_2.question: Which city has most number of arriving flights?

course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Teacher_ID NUMBER);

course_teach.question: What are the names of the teachers and how many courses do they teach?
course_teach.query: SELECT T2.Name ,  COUNT(*) FROM course_arrange AS T1 JOIN teacher AS T2 ON T1.Teacher_ID  =  T2.Teacher_ID GROUP BY T2.Name
course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE course (Course_ID NUMBER, Course TEXT); CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Teacher_ID NUMBER);

course_teach.question: Show names of teachers that teach at least two courses.
course_teach.query: SELECT T2.Name FROM course_arrange AS T1 JOIN teacher AS T2 ON T1.Teacher_ID  =  T2.Teacher_ID GROUP BY T2.Name HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2
course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Teacher_ID NUMBER);

course_teach.question: What are the names of the teachers who teach at least two courses?
course_teach.query: SELECT T2.Name FROM course_arrange AS T1 JOIN teacher AS T2 ON T1.Teacher_ID  =  T2.Teacher_ID GROUP BY T2.Name HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2
course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Teacher_ID NUMBER);

course_teach.question: List the names of teachers who have not been arranged to teach courses.
course_teach.query: SELECT Name FROM teacher WHERE Teacher_id NOT IN (SELECT Teacher_id FROM course_arrange)
course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Course_ID NUMBER, Teacher_ID NUMBER);

course_teach.question: What are the names of the teachers whose courses have not been arranged?
course_teach.query: SELECT Name FROM teacher WHERE Teacher_id NOT IN (SELECT Teacher_id FROM course_arrange)
course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE course (Course_ID NUMBER, Course TEXT); CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Course_ID NUMBER, Teacher_ID NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: How many visitors below age 30 are there?
museum_visit.query: SELECT count(*) FROM visitor WHERE age  <  30
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Age NUMBER); CREATE TABLE visit (visitor_ID TEXT);

museum_visit.question: Find the names of the visitors whose membership level is higher than 4, and order the results by the level from high to low.
museum_visit.query: SELECT name FROM visitor WHERE Level_of_membership  >  4 ORDER BY Level_of_membership DESC
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Level_of_membership NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What is the average age of the visitors whose membership level is not higher than 4?
museum_visit.query: SELECT avg(age) FROM visitor WHERE Level_of_membership  <=  4
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Level_of_membership NUMBER, Age NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: Find the name and membership level of the visitors whose membership level is higher than 4, and sort by their age from old to young.
museum_visit.query: SELECT name ,  Level_of_membership FROM visitor WHERE Level_of_membership  >  4 ORDER BY age DESC
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visitor (Name TEXT, Level_of_membership NUMBER, Age NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: Find the id and name of the museum that has the most staff members?
museum_visit.query: SELECT museum_id ,  name FROM museum ORDER BY num_of_staff DESC LIMIT 1
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Num_of_Staff NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: Find the average number of staff working for the museums that were open before 2009.
museum_visit.query: SELECT avg(num_of_staff) FROM museum WHERE open_year  <  2009
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Num_of_Staff NUMBER, Open_Year TEXT);

museum_visit.question: What are the opening year and staff number of the museum named Plaza Museum?
museum_visit.query: SELECT Num_of_Staff ,  Open_Year FROM museum WHERE name  =  'Plaza Museum'
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Name TEXT, Num_of_Staff NUMBER, Open_Year TEXT);

museum_visit.question: find the names of museums which have more staff than the minimum staff number of all museums opened after 2010.
museum_visit.query: SELECT name FROM museum WHERE num_of_staff  >  (SELECT min(num_of_staff) FROM museum WHERE open_year  >  2010)
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Name TEXT, Num_of_Staff NUMBER, Open_Year TEXT);

museum_visit.question: find the id, name and age for visitors who visited some museums more than once.
museum_visit.query: SELECT t1.id ,  t1.name ,  t1.age FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id GROUP BY t1.id HAVING count(*)  >  1
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Age NUMBER); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER, visitor_ID TEXT);

museum_visit.question: What are the id, name and membership level of visitors who have spent the largest amount of money in total in all museum tickets?
museum_visit.query: SELECT t2.visitor_id ,  t1.name ,  t1.Level_of_membership FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id GROUP BY t2.visitor_id ORDER BY sum(t2.Total_spent) DESC LIMIT 1
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Level_of_membership NUMBER); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER, visitor_ID TEXT, Num_of_Ticket NUMBER, Total_spent NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What are the id and name of the museum visited most times?
museum_visit.query: SELECT t2.Museum_ID ,  t1.name FROM museum AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.Museum_ID  =  t2.Museum_ID GROUP BY t2.Museum_ID ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What is the name of the museum that had no visitor yet?
museum_visit.query: SELECT name FROM museum WHERE Museum_ID NOT IN (SELECT museum_id FROM visit)
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: Find the name and age of the visitor who bought the most tickets at once.
museum_visit.query: SELECT t1.name ,  t1.age FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id ORDER BY t2.num_of_ticket DESC LIMIT 1
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Age NUMBER); CREATE TABLE visit (visitor_ID TEXT, Num_of_Ticket NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What are the average and maximum number of tickets bought in all visits?
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visit (Num_of_Ticket NUMBER, Total_spent NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What is the total ticket expense of the visitors whose membership level is 1?
museum_visit.query: SELECT sum(t2.Total_spent) FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id WHERE t1.Level_of_membership  =  1
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Level_of_membership NUMBER); CREATE TABLE visit (visitor_ID TEXT, Num_of_Ticket NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What is the name of the visitor who visited both a museum opened before 2009 and a museum opened after 2011?
museum_visit.query: SELECT t1.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.Museum_ID  =  t2.Museum_ID WHERE t3.open_year  <  2009 INTERSECT SELECT t1.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.Museum_ID  =  t2.Museum_ID WHERE t3.open_year  >  2011
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Open_Year TEXT); CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER, visitor_ID TEXT);

museum_visit.question: Find the number of visitors who did not visit any museum opened after 2010.
museum_visit.query: SELECT count(*) FROM visitor WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT t2.visitor_id FROM museum AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.Museum_ID  =  t2.Museum_ID WHERE t1.open_year  >  2010)
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Open_Year TEXT); CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER, visitor_ID TEXT);

museum_visit.question: How many museums were opened after 2013 or before 2008?
museum_visit.query: SELECT count(*) FROM museum WHERE open_year  >  2013 OR open_year  <  2008
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Open_Year TEXT);

wta_1.schema: CREATE TABLE players (player_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE matches (loser_ht NUMBER, loser_id NUMBER, loser_name TEXT, winner_entry TEXT, winner_ht NUMBER, winner_id NUMBER, winner_name TEXT, year NUMBER);

wta_1.question: What are the country code and first name of the players who won in both tourney WTA Championships and Australian Open?
wta_1.query: SELECT T1.country_code ,  T1.first_name FROM players AS T1 JOIN matches AS T2 ON T1.player_id  =  T2.winner_id WHERE T2.tourney_name  =  'WTA Championships' INTERSECT SELECT T1.country_code ,  T1.first_name FROM players AS T1 JOIN matches AS T2 ON T1.player_id  =  T2.winner_id WHERE T2.tourney_name  =  'Australian Open'

wta_1.question: What are the first names and country codes for players who won both the WTA Championships and the Australian Open?

wta_1.question: Find the first name and country code of the player who did the most number of tours.

wta_1.question: What is the first name and country code of the player with the most tours?

wta_1.question: What is the code of the country with the most players?

wta_1.question: Find the codes of countries that have more than 50 players.

wta_1.question: What are the codes of countries with more than 50 players?

wta_1.question: Find the total number of tours for each ranking date.

wta_1.question: How many total tours were there for each ranking date?

wta_1.question: Find the name and rank of the 3 youngest winners across all matches.
wta_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT winner_name ,  winner_rank FROM matches ORDER BY winner_age LIMIT 3

wta_1.question: How many different winners both participated in the WTA Championships and were left handed?

wta_1.question: Find the number of left handed winners who participated in the WTA Championships.

wta_1.question: Find the first name, country code and birth date of the winner who has the highest rank points in all matches.
wta_1.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.country_code ,  T1.birth_date FROM players AS T1 JOIN matches AS T2 ON T1.player_id  =  T2.winner_id ORDER BY T2.winner_rank_points DESC LIMIT 1

wta_1.question: What is the first name, country code, and birth date of the player with the most winner rank points across all matches?
wta_1.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.country_code ,  T1.birth_date FROM players AS T1 JOIN matches AS T2 ON T1.player_id  =  T2.winner_id ORDER BY T2.winner_rank_points DESC LIMIT 1
wta_1.schema: CREATE TABLE players (player_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT, birth_date TIME, country_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE matches (loser_age NUMBER, loser_id NUMBER, loser_rank NUMBER, loser_rank_points NUMBER, winner_age NUMBER, winner_ht NUMBER, winner_id NUMBER, winner_name TEXT, winner_rank NUMBER, winner_rank_points NUMBER); CREATE TABLE rankings (ranking_date TIME, player_id NUMBER, ranking_points NUMBER);

battle_death.question: How many ships ended up being 'Captured'?
battle_death.query: SELECT count(*) FROM ship WHERE disposition_of_ship  =  'Captured'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, name TEXT, result TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (lost_in_battle NUMBER, id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE death (caused_by_ship_id NUMBER);

battle_death.question: List the name and tonnage ordered by in descending alphaetical order for the names.
battle_death.query: SELECT name ,  tonnage FROM ship ORDER BY name DESC
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (name TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (name TEXT, tonnage TEXT);

battle_death.question: List the name, date and result of each battle.
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (name TEXT, date TEXT, result TEXT);

battle_death.question: What is maximum and minimum death toll caused each time?
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE death (id NUMBER, killed NUMBER);

battle_death.question: What is the average number of injuries caused each time?
What are the death and injury situations caused by the ship with tonnage 't'?
battle_death.query: SELECT T1.killed ,  T1.injured FROM death AS T1 JOIN ship AS t2 ON T1.caused_by_ship_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.tonnage  =  't'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE ship (id NUMBER, tonnage TEXT); CREATE TABLE death (caused_by_ship_id NUMBER, killed NUMBER, injured NUMBER);

battle_death.question: What are the name and results of the battles when the bulgarian commander is not 'Boril'
battle_death.query: SELECT name ,  RESULT FROM battle WHERE bulgarian_commander != 'Boril'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (name TEXT, bulgarian_commander TEXT, latin_commander TEXT, result TEXT);

battle_death.question: What are the different ids and names of the battles that lost any 'Brig' type shipes?
battle_death.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.id ,  T1.name FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.ship_type  =  'Brig'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (lost_in_battle NUMBER, id NUMBER, name TEXT, ship_type TEXT); CREATE TABLE death (caused_by_ship_id NUMBER);

battle_death.question: What are the ids and names of the battles that led to more than 10 people killed in total.
battle_death.query: SELECT T1.id ,  T1.name FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle JOIN death AS T3 ON T2.id  =  T3.caused_by_ship_id GROUP BY T1.id HAVING sum(T3.killed)  >  10
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, name TEXT, result TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (lost_in_battle NUMBER); CREATE TABLE death (id NUMBER, killed NUMBER, injured NUMBER);

battle_death.question: What is the ship id and name that caused most total injuries?
battle_death.query: SELECT T2.id ,  T2.name FROM death AS T1 JOIN ship AS t2 ON T1.caused_by_ship_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T2.id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE ship (id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE death (caused_by_ship_id NUMBER, injured NUMBER);

battle_death.question: What are the distinct battle names which are between bulgarian commander 'Kaloyan' and latin commander 'Baldwin I'?
battle_death.query: SELECT name FROM battle WHERE bulgarian_commander  =  'Kaloyan' AND latin_commander  =  'Baldwin I'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (name TEXT, bulgarian_commander TEXT, latin_commander TEXT);

battle_death.question: How many different results are there for the battles?
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, result TEXT);

battle_death.question: How many battles did not lose any ship with tonnage '225'?
battle_death.query: SELECT count(*) FROM battle WHERE id NOT IN ( SELECT lost_in_battle FROM ship WHERE tonnage  =  '225' );
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, name TEXT, result TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (lost_in_battle NUMBER, tonnage TEXT);

battle_death.question: List the name and date the battle that has lost the ship named 'Lettice' and the ship named 'HMS Atalanta'
battle_death.query: SELECT T1.name ,  T1.date FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.name  =  'Lettice' INTERSECT SELECT T1.name ,  T1.date FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.name  =  'HMS Atalanta'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, name TEXT, date TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (lost_in_battle NUMBER, id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE death (caused_by_ship_id NUMBER);

battle_death.question: Show names, results and bulgarian commanders of the battles with no ships lost in the 'English Channel'.
battle_death.query: SELECT name ,  RESULT ,  bulgarian_commander FROM battle EXCEPT SELECT T1.name ,  T1.result ,  T1.bulgarian_commander FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.location  =  'English Channel'
battle_death.schema: CREATE TABLE battle (id NUMBER, name TEXT, bulgarian_commander TEXT, latin_commander TEXT, result TEXT); CREATE TABLE ship (lost_in_battle NUMBER, id NUMBER, name TEXT);

student_transcripts_tracking.question: Find the last name of the students who currently live in the state of North Carolina but have not registered in any degree program.

voter_1.question: List the vote ids, phone numbers and states of all votes.

voter_1.question: What are the names of the contestants whose names are not 'Jessie Alloway'

voter_1.question: What are the contestant numbers and names of the contestants who had at least two votes?
voter_1.query: SELECT T1.contestant_number , T1.contestant_name FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number GROUP BY T1.contestant_number HAVING count(*)  >=  2
voter_1.schema: CREATE TABLE CONTESTANTS (contestant_number NUMBER, contestant_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE VOTES (vote_id NUMBER, contestant_number NUMBER);

voter_1.question: Of all the contestants who got voted, what is the contestant number and name of the contestant who got least votes?
voter_1.query: SELECT T1.contestant_number , T1.contestant_name FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number GROUP BY T1.contestant_number ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1
voter_1.schema: CREATE TABLE CONTESTANTS (contestant_number NUMBER, contestant_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE VOTES (vote_id NUMBER, contestant_number NUMBER);

voter_1.question: What are the number of votes from state 'NY' or 'CA'?

voter_1.question: How many contestants did not get voted?

voter_1.question: What is the area code in which the most voters voted?
voter_1.query: SELECT T1.area_code FROM area_code_state AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.state  =  T2.state GROUP BY T1.area_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
voter_1.schema: CREATE TABLE AREA_CODE_STATE (area_code NUMBER, state TEXT); CREATE TABLE VOTES (state TEXT);

voter_1.question: What are the create dates, states, and phone numbers of the votes that were for the contestant named 'Tabatha Gehling'?
voter_1.query: SELECT T2.created ,  T2.state ,  T2.phone_number FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number WHERE T1.contestant_name  =  'Tabatha Gehling'
voter_1.schema: CREATE TABLE CONTESTANTS (contestant_number NUMBER, contestant_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE VOTES (phone_number NUMBER, state TEXT, contestant_number NUMBER, created TIME);

voter_1.question: List the area codes in which voters voted both for the contestant 'Tabatha Gehling' and the contestant 'Kelly Clauss'.
voter_1.query: SELECT T3.area_code FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number JOIN area_code_state AS T3 ON T2.state  =  T3.state WHERE T1.contestant_name  =  'Tabatha Gehling' INTERSECT SELECT T3.area_code FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number JOIN area_code_state AS T3 ON T2.state  =  T3.state WHERE T1.contestant_name  =  'Kelly Clauss'
voter_1.schema: CREATE TABLE AREA_CODE_STATE (area_code NUMBER, state TEXT); CREATE TABLE CONTESTANTS (contestant_number NUMBER, contestant_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE VOTES (vote_id NUMBER, state TEXT, contestant_number NUMBER);

world_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.Region FROM country AS T1 JOIN countrylanguage AS T2 ON T1.Code  =  T2.CountryCode WHERE T2.Language  =  "English" OR T2.Language  =  "Dutch"
world_1.schema: CREATE TABLE country (Code TEXT, Name TEXT, Region TEXT, LocalName TEXT); CREATE TABLE countrylanguage (CountryCode TEXT, Language TEXT);

world_1.question: Which regions speak Dutch or English?

world_1.question: What are the countries where either English or Dutch is the official language?
world_1.query: select t1.name from country as t1 join countrylanguage as t2 on t1.code  =  t2.countrycode where t2.language  =  "english" and isofficial  =  "t" union select t1.name from country as t1 join countrylanguage as t2 on t1.code  =  t2.countrycode where t2.language  =  "dutch" and isofficial  =  "t"
world_1.schema: CREATE TABLE country (Code TEXT, Name TEXT, Continent TEXT, GNPOld NUMBER, Code2 TEXT); CREATE TABLE countrylanguage (CountryCode TEXT, Language TEXT, IsOfficial TEXT);

world_1.question: Which countries have either English or Dutch as an official language?
world_1.query: SELECT * FROM country AS T1 JOIN countrylanguage AS T2 ON T1.Code  =  T2.CountryCode WHERE T2.Language  =  "English" AND IsOfficial  =  "T" UNION SELECT * FROM country AS T1 JOIN countrylanguage AS T2 ON T1.Code  =  T2.CountryCode WHERE T2.Language  =  "Dutch" AND IsOfficial  =  "T"
world_1.schema: CREATE TABLE city (CountryCode TEXT); CREATE TABLE country (Code TEXT, Name TEXT, Continent TEXT, LocalName TEXT, Code2 TEXT); CREATE TABLE countrylanguage (CountryCode TEXT, Language TEXT, IsOfficial TEXT);

world_1.question: Which language is the most popular on the Asian continent?
world_1.query: SELECT T2.Language FROM country AS T1 JOIN countrylanguage AS T2 ON T1.Code  =  T2.CountryCode WHERE T1.Continent  =  "Asia" GROUP BY T2.Language ORDER BY COUNT (*) DESC LIMIT 1

network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id INTERSECT SELECT T2.name FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.liked_id  =  T2.id
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Count the number of likes for each student id.
network_1.query: SELECT student_id ,  count(*) FROM Likes GROUP BY student_id
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: How many likes correspond to each student id?
network_1.query: SELECT student_id ,  count(*) FROM Likes GROUP BY student_id
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Show the names of high schoolers who have likes, and numbers of likes for each.
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name ,  count(*) FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T1.student_id
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What are the names of high schoolers who have likes, and how many likes does each have?
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name ,  count(*) FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T1.student_id
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What is the name of the high schooler who has the greatest number of likes?
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T1.student_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Give the name of the student with the most likes.
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T1.student_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Show the names of students who have at least 2 likes.
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What are the names of students who have 2 or more likes?
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Show the names of students who have a grade higher than 5 and have at least 2 friends.
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.grade  >  5 GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What are the names of high schoolers who have a grade of over 5 and have 2 or more friends?
network_1.query: SELECT T2.name FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.grade  >  5 GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: How many likes does Kyle have?
network_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.name  =  "Kyle"
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Return the number of likes that the high schooler named Kyle has.
network_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Likes AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.name  =  "Kyle"
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Find the average grade of all students who have some friends.
network_1.query: SELECT avg(grade) FROM Highschooler WHERE id IN (SELECT T1.student_id FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id)
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What is the average grade of students who have friends?
network_1.query: SELECT avg(grade) FROM Highschooler WHERE id IN (SELECT T1.student_id FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id)
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Find the minimum grade of students who have no friends.
network_1.query: SELECT min(grade) FROM Highschooler WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT T1.student_id FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id)
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What is the lowest grade of students who do not have any friends?
network_1.query: SELECT min(grade) FROM Highschooler WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT T1.student_id FROM Friend AS T1 JOIN Highschooler AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.id)
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, grade NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Friend (student_id NUMBER, friend_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Likes (liked_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which states have both owners and professionals living there?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT state FROM Owners INTERSECT SELECT state FROM Professionals
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, state TEXT, zip_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, city TEXT, state TEXT, zip_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Find the states where both owners and professionals live.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT state FROM Owners INTERSECT SELECT state FROM Professionals
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, city TEXT, state TEXT, zip_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (city TEXT, state TEXT, zip_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: What is the average age of the dogs who have gone through any treatments?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT avg(age) FROM Dogs WHERE dog_id IN ( SELECT dog_id FROM Treatments )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, age TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Find the average age of the dogs who went through treatments.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT avg(age) FROM Dogs WHERE dog_id IN ( SELECT dog_id FROM Treatments )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, age TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which professionals live in the state of Indiana or have done treatment on more than 2 treatments? List his or her id, last name and cell phone.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id ,  last_name ,  cell_number FROM Professionals WHERE state  =  'Indiana' UNION SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.last_name ,  T1.cell_number FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id GROUP BY T1.professional_id HAVING count(*)  >  2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, city TEXT, state TEXT, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Find the id, last name and cell phone of the professionals who live in the state of Indiana or have performed more than two treatments.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id ,  last_name ,  cell_number FROM Professionals WHERE state  =  'Indiana' UNION SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.last_name ,  T1.cell_number FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id GROUP BY T1.professional_id HAVING count(*)  >  2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, state TEXT, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which dogs have not cost their owner more than 1000 for treatment ? List the dog names.
dog_kennels.query: select name from dogs where dog_id not in ( select dog_id from treatments group by dog_id having sum(cost_of_treatment)  >  1000 )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What are the names of the dogs for which the owner has not spend more than 1000 for treatment?
dog_kennels.query: select name from dogs where dog_id not in ( select dog_id from treatments group by dog_id having sum(cost_of_treatment)  >  1000 )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which first names are used for professionals or owners but are not used as dog names?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT first_name FROM Professionals UNION SELECT first_name FROM Owners EXCEPT SELECT name FROM Dogs
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Find the first names that are used for professionals or owners but are not used as dog names.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT first_name FROM Professionals UNION SELECT first_name FROM Owners EXCEPT SELECT name FROM Dogs
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which professional did not operate any treatment on dogs? List the professional's id, role and email.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id ,  role_code ,  email_address FROM Professionals EXCEPT SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.role_code ,  T1.email_address FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Give me the id, role and email of the professionals who did not perform any treatment on dogs.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id ,  role_code ,  email_address FROM Professionals EXCEPT SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.role_code ,  T1.email_address FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, last_name TEXT, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which owner owns the most dogs? List the owner id, first name and last name.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.owner_id ,  T2.first_name ,  T2.last_name FROM Dogs AS T1 JOIN Owners AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id GROUP BY T1.owner_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Return the owner id, first name and last name of the owner who has the most dogs.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.owner_id ,  T2.first_name ,  T2.last_name FROM Dogs AS T1 JOIN Owners AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id GROUP BY T1.owner_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which professionals have done at least two treatments? List the professional's id, role, and first name.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.role_code ,  T1.first_name FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id GROUP BY T1.professional_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What are the id, role, and first name of the professionals who have performed two or more treatments?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.role_code ,  T1.first_name FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id GROUP BY T1.professional_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What is the name of the breed with the most dogs?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.breed_name FROM Breeds AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.breed_code  =  T2.breed_code GROUP BY T1.breed_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which breed do the most dogs have? Give me the breed name.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.breed_name FROM Breeds AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.breed_code  =  T2.breed_code GROUP BY T1.breed_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which owner has paid for the most treatments on his or her dogs? List the owner id and last name.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.owner_id ,  T1.last_name FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id JOIN Treatments AS T3 ON T2.dog_id  =  T3.dog_id GROUP BY T1.owner_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Tell me the owner id and last name of the owner who spent the most on treatments of his or her dogs.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.owner_id ,  T1.last_name FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id JOIN Treatments AS T3 ON T2.dog_id  =  T3.dog_id GROUP BY T1.owner_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, dog_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What is the description of the treatment type that costs the least money in total?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.treatment_type_description FROM Treatment_types AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.treatment_type_code  =  T2.treatment_type_code GROUP BY T1.treatment_type_code ORDER BY sum(cost_of_treatment) ASC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT, treatment_type_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_type_code TEXT, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Give me the description of the treatment type whose total cost is the lowest.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.treatment_type_description FROM Treatment_types AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.treatment_type_code  =  T2.treatment_type_code GROUP BY T1.treatment_type_code ORDER BY sum(cost_of_treatment) ASC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT, treatment_type_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_type_code TEXT, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which owner has paid the largest amount of money in total for their dogs? Show the owner id and zip code.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.owner_id ,  T1.zip_code FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id JOIN Treatments AS T3 ON T2.dog_id  =  T3.dog_id GROUP BY T1.owner_id ORDER BY sum(T3.cost_of_treatment) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, last_name TEXT, zip_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (zip_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Find the owner id and zip code of the owner who spent the most money in total for his or her dogs.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.owner_id ,  T1.zip_code FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id JOIN Treatments AS T3 ON T2.dog_id  =  T3.dog_id GROUP BY T1.owner_id ORDER BY sum(T3.cost_of_treatment) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, last_name TEXT, zip_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (zip_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which professionals have done at least two types of treatments? List the professional id and cell phone.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.cell_number FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id GROUP BY T1.professional_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Find the id and cell phone of the professionals who operate two or more types of treatments.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.professional_id ,  T1.cell_number FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id GROUP BY T1.professional_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: What are the first name and last name of the professionals who have done treatment with cost below average?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 WHERE cost_of_treatment  <  ( SELECT avg(cost_of_treatment) FROM Treatments )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which professionals have operated a treatment that costs less than the average? Give me theor first names and last names.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name FROM Professionals AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 WHERE cost_of_treatment  <  ( SELECT avg(cost_of_treatment) FROM Treatments )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: List the date of each treatment, together with the first name of the professional who operated it.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.date_of_treatment ,  T2.first_name FROM Treatments AS T1 JOIN Professionals AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, date_of_treatment TIME);

dog_kennels.question: What are the date and the operating professional's first name of each treatment?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.date_of_treatment ,  T2.first_name FROM Treatments AS T1 JOIN Professionals AS T2 ON T1.professional_id  =  T2.professional_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, date_of_treatment TIME);

dog_kennels.question: List the cost of each treatment and the corresponding treatment type description.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.cost_of_treatment ,  T2.treatment_type_description FROM Treatments AS T1 JOIN treatment_types AS T2 ON T1.treatment_type_code  =  T2.treatment_type_code
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT, treatment_type_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_type_code TEXT, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What are the cost and treatment type description of each treatment?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.cost_of_treatment ,  T2.treatment_type_description FROM Treatments AS T1 JOIN treatment_types AS T2 ON T1.treatment_type_code  =  T2.treatment_type_code
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT, treatment_type_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_type_code TEXT, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: List each owner's first name, last name, and the size of his for her dog.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name ,  T2.size_code FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Sizes (size_code TEXT, size_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, size_code TEXT, name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: What are each owner's first name, last name, and the size of their dog?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name ,  T2.size_code FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Sizes (size_code TEXT, size_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, size_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: List pairs of the owner's first name and the dogs's name.

dog_kennels.question: What are each owner's first name and their dogs's name?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T2.name FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (first_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: List the names of the dogs of the rarest breed and the treatment dates of them.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.name ,  T2.date_of_treatment FROM Dogs AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.dog_id  =  T2.dog_id WHERE T1.breed_code  =  ( SELECT breed_code FROM Dogs GROUP BY breed_code ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1 )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, date_of_treatment TIME);

dog_kennels.question: Which dogs are of the rarest breed? Show their names and treatment dates.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.name ,  T2.date_of_treatment FROM Dogs AS T1 JOIN Treatments AS T2 ON T1.dog_id  =  T2.dog_id WHERE T1.breed_code  =  ( SELECT breed_code FROM Dogs GROUP BY breed_code ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1 )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT, breed_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, date_of_treatment TIME);

dog_kennels.question: Which dogs are owned by someone who lives in Virginia? List the owner's first name and the dog's name.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T2.name FROM Owners AS T1 JOIN Dogs AS T2 ON T1.owner_id  =  T2.owner_id WHERE T1.state  =  'Virginia'
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT, state TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (first_name TEXT);

real_estate_properties.question: What is the feature type name of feature AirCon?

real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Ref_Feature_Types (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_type_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Other_Available_Features (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_name TEXT);

real_estate_properties.question: Show the property type descriptions of properties belonging to that code.
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT T2.property_type_description FROM Properties AS T1 JOIN Ref_Property_Types AS T2 ON T1.property_type_code  =  T2.property_type_code GROUP BY T1.property_type_code
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Ref_Property_Types (property_type_code TEXT, property_type_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Properties (property_type_code TEXT);

real_estate_properties.question: What are the names of properties that are either houses or apartments with more than 1 room?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT property_name FROM Properties WHERE property_type_code  =  "House" UNION SELECT property_name FROM Properties WHERE property_type_code  =  "Apartment" AND room_count  >  1
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Properties (property_name TEXT, room_count NUMBER);
